page.title: 02Gargrave, Transport.
page.content: The{Keighley to Kendal Trunk Road} -A65- bisects the village, with services by{Pennine}buses, based in the village at Grouse Garage. Their 15 buses run West from{Skipton}and from Gargrave to{Malham.} Gargrave Station, now an unmanned halt is served by{British Rail}on the{Leeds {/ Carnforth}&{Leeds / Carlisle}lines, although services on the latter are becoming fewer, as British Rail intend to close this line. The{Leeds and Liverpool Canal}reaches its most Northerly point at{Ray Bridge in the village. It then climbs 6 locks to reach{Bank Newton.}After a long period in declne, it has now become very busy again with{pleasure boats} The long distance footpath,{The {Pennine Way}enters the area by{ {Scaleber}and the village by the old school, and continues North to{Malham.
